Description: Book of Caverns of Nedjmet, final rebirth scene; sheet 3; red and black vignette; Hieratic text in red and black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by Giuseppina Lenzo, Lausanne (in BAAe series). Published: A. Niwiński, 1989, Studies on the Illustrated Theban Funerary Papyri of the 11th and 10th centuries BC. OBO 86, Fribourg-Göttingen, p l.49a.-c (partial). Lenzo, G. 2023. The Book of the Dead in the Third Intermediate Period, in: Lucarelli, R. and M.A. Stadler (eds), The Oxford Handbook of the Egyptian Book of the Dead (online edn, Oxford Academic, 20 June 2023), 89.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (126)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134518) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134518)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2013 May - September, Perth, Western Australian Museum, The Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached Black ink Red ink Backed: brown paper Displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass, wooden backboard (old frame) Binding:Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
